contents: Article 7 (Demotion and Expulsion) ① The Sports Association may demote or expel member organizations that fall under any of the following items in accordance with Article 13 of the Articles of Incorporation. 1. When a member loses the requirements for membership or promotion 2. When deemed unsuitable as a member of the Sports Association in violation of Article 10 of the Articles of Incorporation 3. Normal business as a member organization due to reasons such as disputes between executives, worsening finances, and absence of the executive branch Cases where performance is impossible 4. Cases where member organizations have seriously violated the status of the Sports Council or hindered the development of sports by causing social controversy due to sports corruption under Article 2 of the National Sports Promotion Act 5. National Assembly, Board of Audit and Inspection, Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism ② The membership/grade deliberation committee must comprehensively judge the following matters regarding demotion or expulsion and handle them fairly, and make the final decision on demotion or expulsion. is determined by resolution of the board of directors or general meeting in accordance with Article 13 of the Articles of Incorporation. 1. Degree of misconduct and negligence 2. Problems in case of demotion or expulsion 3. Possibility of improvement 4. Possibility of implementing disciplinary action pursuant to Paragraph 1 No. 5 ③ Evaluation result pursuant to Article 47-3 of Member Sports Organization Regulations is the lowest in the past 3 years If the level is low, the Sports Council will demote the organization. ④ If an organization designated as a management organization pursuant to Article 12 of the Sports Association Articles of Incorporation fails to have its designation as a management organization revoked for two years from the date of designation as a management organization, the Sports Association shall expel the organization.
